pr_title: Propagate stat calculation failures in tests

timeline.message:
Fix partition key min/max derivation when NaN

Previously the code was implicitly ignoring NaN values, unless partition
with NaN was first on the list.

Install SystemAccessControl in tests

This allows a session to have a system session property. Without
`AllowAllSystemAccessControl`, this would fail with:

```
io.prestosql.spi.PrestoException: Presto server is still initializing
	at io.prestosql.security.AccessControlManager$InitializingSystemAccessControl.delegate(AccessControlManager.java:1063)
	at io.prestosql.plugin.base.security.ForwardingSystemAccessControl.checkCanSetSystemSessionProperty(ForwardingSystemAccessControl.java:106)
	at io.prestosql.security.AccessControlManager.lambda$checkCanSetSystemSessionProperty$63(AccessControlManager.java:735)
	at io.prestosql.security.AccessControlManager.systemAuthorizationCheck(AccessControlManager.java:984)
	at io.prestosql.security.AccessControlManager.checkCanSetSystemSessionProperty(AccessControlManager.java:735)
```
Propagate stat calculation failures in tests
Propagate stat calculation failures in tests

timeline.bodyText: let's have a new dedicated test, instead of making this one more complicate
timeline.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText:
i thought about this, but i couldn't invent the name for the test method.
Also, this is the test which was supposed to test the problem (d068a3f) and indeed it did, but not deterministically (order of partitions on the list mattered). So I am improving the existing test to make it more deterministic.
replies.author: findepi
